questions.promptMd: Which pairing best matches objection → strongest proof?

answers.contentMd: Integration complexity → demo with sample data + pilot
answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Demonstrations and pilots de‑risk complexity.
Price objections need TCO/ROI, not just stories.

answers.contentMd: Timing concerns → ignore and push urgency
answers.feedbackMd: Address timing with contingencies and plan options.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Pre‑empting objections in your narrative can reduce friction later.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Anticipation builds credibility and saves time.
Ignoring objections delays resolution and undermines trust.

questions.promptMd: What is the main risk of overloading with evidence?

answers.contentMd: Audience misses the core signal and stalls
answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Curate the most credible 1–2 proofs.

questions.promptMd: True or False: Addressing status/identity threats is outside the scope of objection handling.

answers.feedbackMd: Identity threats are real blockers; address respectfully with stories and options.
Correct. Combine data with empathetic framing to address status concerns.
